intro: Calonyction bona-nox subvar. calvum, commonly known as the night-blooming moonflower, is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hard seeds.
